title: Château la Ribaud 2015  Médoc
description: This is the first vintage of this estate under the ownership of the Bouey family, which has a Bordeaux negociant business. The wine is dry, anchored in tannins at this stage although the juicy black fruits will come through over time. Wait for this wine until 2022.

title: Château Lacombe Noaillac 2015  Médoc
description: This is one of the most northerly of the Médoc estates, only six miles from the ocean. That gives a cool feel to the wine, emphasizing fruit rather than structure. Plenty of juicy acidity gives the wine a lift. Drink from 2022.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2008 Bordón Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Roasted-plum aromas are earthy and leafy, with a whiff of maple. A hard, sinewy palate features bumpy tannins and astringency. Cherry and berry flavors are a touch burnt, while mocha and coffee notes rise up on a finish that's almost syrupy in texture.

title: Bodegas Vínícola Real 2007 200 Monges Selección Especial Reserva Blanco White (Rioja)
description: A gold color and resiny aromas of nutty oak and oxidized white fruits capture the essence of aged white Rioja. A round, oily palate is dominated by oak, tasting of spiced apple, almond skins and woodspice. Flavors of peanut, dried apricot and stone-fruit pits provide for a good finish.

title: Bollig-Lehnert 2016 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Intense aromas of smoke, crushed earth and pollen permeate through sweet-tart lemon and lime flavors. It's savory yet invigorating, offering penetrating streaks of acidity that linger through a long finish.

title: Bonny Doon 2016 Grenache (Monterey County)
description: This blend of three vineyards, including one in Santa Barbara County, offers intriguing sweet-and-sour aromas of dried sage, bay leaf, forest floor and olive tapenade. Dried berry fruit shows on the sip alongside chaparral, and it tastes much older than its young age.

title: Broadbent NV Auction Reserva  (Port)
description: Produced by Niepoort for the importer, this dense wine is rich in prunes and ripe black plums. Poised between sweet and dry, it has tannins as well as generous fruitiness and a liquorous, smooth aftertaste.

title: Cambridge & Sunset 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a solid-quality wine that tastes good and fruity, has a nice blend of acidity and richness and a rather full body that coats the palate. It's enjoyable to drink and seems to have everything in good proportions.

title: Casteani 2012 Terra di Casteani  (Maremma Toscana)
description: Aromas of cedar, dark-skinned fruit and baking spice lead the nose on this 70% Sangiovese and 30% Merlot blend. The firm palate offers black plum, clove and toast with tight assertive tannins. Drink 2019–2023.

title: Château d'Uza 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Taut, nervy and mineral, this is a tight wine. It has tension that lies under crisp grapefruit and gooseberry fruit. It will need a few years to come together, and should be ready to drink from 2020.

title: Château les Clauzots 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Spicy from wood aging, this is a rich wine with hints of stalky black fruit flavors. It is a bright and crisp with acidity with a light touch of tannins at the end.

title: Château Roquetaillade la Grange 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. This is a dense wine, with ripe berry fruit flavors along with layers of plush tannins. Concentrated and warm fruits give this wine its roundness, it will likely age over the medium term. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Potensac 2017 La Chapelle de Potensac Barrel Sample  (Médoc)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. This Merlot-dominated wine is soft with easy fruit, gentle tannins and a fine, juicy backdrop of black currant flavors. It is lively and fruity, with great acidity and a light structure. It will be ready for drinking early.
designation: La Chapelle de Potensac Barrel Sample

title: Château la Bridane 2017 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Julien)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. Firm and tannic, this wine has good structure, along with dark chocolate and spice notes from the new wood aging. The fruit, hiding behind the structure, has not yet shown itself apart from the acidity at the end.

title: Campo al Mare 2016  Bolgheri
description: Made with 80% Merlot, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Cabernet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot, this has aromas of ripe black plum, vanilla and a touch of caramel. The dense palate offers black-currant jam, sweet exotic spice and a hint of licorice alongside round tannins.

title: Cantele 2016 Negroamaro Rosato (Salento)
description: Cranberry and wild strawberry aromas lead on the nose of this Rosato. Creamy in feel, with a healthy vein of acidity, the palate brings flavors of herbs and watermelon. Soft tannins offer support and help extend the finish.

title: Cardwell Hill 2014 Monet Blocks Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a clonal mix—Pommard, Wädenswil, Dijon 115 and 777—with leathery aromas around candied-fruit flavors. Ginger cookies and intense baking spices dominate, although the leathery character somewhat diminishes the fruit and dampens down the finish.

title: Cardwell Hill 2014 Pommard Block Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Sticking closely with the winery's style of forward fruity spicy wines, this has a burst of strawberry and raspberry flavors, backed with juicy acids and baking spices. There's a slightly chalky quality to the finish.

title: Cave de Turckheim 2016 Sylvaner (Alsace)
description: The closed nose has an earthy tint. On the palate this gives way to a pithy note of lemon and a bright, sunny freshness. This is light, fresh and has a superclean, dry finish.

title: Château d'Aurilhac 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This rich wine is juicy with black-currant fruit and crisp with acidity. The wood aging is just on the right side of too much, but shows in the wine's spicy, dry character. The fresh fruit should come through strongly as the wine matures. Drink from 2023.

title: Château de Bensse 2015  Médoc
description: While the estate remains family owned, the production is run by the local cooperative. This wine is richly textured, dense with tannins and acidity. Black-currant fruits and a dry core promise aging potential. It will be ready from 2022.

title: Château la Rose de Vitrac 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This wine comes from a sector of the Entre-deux-Mers that is particularly suited to white wines. It shows in this ripe, lightly mineral-textured wine with apple, citrus and touches of spice. Drink this attractive wine from mid-2018.

title: Château Lacour Jacquet 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: Produced by the third generation of the Lartigue family to own this estate, this wine is firm and conveys a strong sense of wood aging over the black-currant fruits. Produced from almost equal proportions of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, it is still very young and needs time to release its full potential. Drink from 2024.

title: Château de Portets 2017 Barrel Sample  (Graves)
description: 87–89. Barrel Sample. While the wood is strongly dominant at this stage, there is plenty of fruit to promise balance in the future for this ripe and full wine. Drink from 2020.

title: 2Hawk 2016 Grenache Rosé (Rogue Valley)
description: This pretty wine is lightly peppery, with excellent concentration. The strawberry fruit is bolstered by bright lemon acidity. Although made from 100% Grenache, a small portion (5%) of finished red wine was added to enhance color and tannin.

title: Argentiera 2016 Ai Ginepri  (Bolgheri)
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc blend offers aromas of ripe blackberry and baking spice. The round, soft palate evokes black cherry jam, vanilla and star anise alongside lithe tannins.

title: August Briggs 2014 Charbono (Calistoga)
description: This is a soft, juicy and approachable wine, in full grasp of grapey cherry flavors that veer overtly fruity. Medium bodied, it's a nice choice for the table, indoors or out.

title: Domaine Virginie Thunevin 2015  Bordeaux
description: From vines close to Fronsac, this wine comes from Thunevin family vines. It is soft, with attractive black-currant fruit and spicy wood and tannins. It will be ready to drink from mid-2018.

title: Duck Pond 2016 St. Jory Vineyard Skin Contact Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: This unusual wine is a bright strawberry shade and offers intense aromatics and flavors of strawberries and ripe cherries. It was fermented on the skins for 14 days, and one-quarter of the total was whole cluster. This is a tasty wine with some citrus snap to the finish.

title: Fatty Pope 2015 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dark strawberry, black plum, fennel pollen, tarragon and a hint of caramel show on the nose of the solid second vintage for this memorably labeled bottle. Ripe purple fruit meets with minty spices on the palate, where the richness is cut by directed acidity.
